comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Parent finds it difficult in Africa to teach their children sex education, also there are few sex education programs carried out by government. This lack of proper sex education makes this young girls get into sex at their early age without knowing the consequences of their action.In Africa,you will see a young girl who is two months pregnant, that don't even know that she is pregnant until she is been told or later when the pregnancy is four months and cannot be hidden. Parents,guardians and government have failed in this aspect of teaching sex education to these young ones.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: In Nigeria, early pregnancies are primarily caused by parents' lack of attention to their female children. In the early years of their life, they were left to care for themselves. They may become pregnant as a result of trying to care for themselves and survive in the culture in which they find themselves.There is a widespread perception throughout Africa that female children are less valuable to their families. It makes no sense to educate them or provide for them because they will eventually get married and take on another man's name. To lessen the responsibility of training and feeding them, it is preferable for them to marry young. Due to the hardships present in most African countries, that is the mindset of the majority of African parents.
